channel.title: [317] Optimized Delta
channel.description:
O hai der [COLOR=red][b]I suggest you guys use a better source like shard, hyperion, or RuneSource.[/b][/COLOR] This was an old source that I found in one of my folders, I was planning on releasing this, but I never did. [B]Client: [/b]http://www.mediafire.com/?baa6x35r6cm4lc8 [B]Server:[/B] http://www.mediafire.com/?vfz6akprg418fv2 I took Jonny's source, DeltaClean, and edited and cleaned it to make it run smoother and make it easier to program. [b]What I did[/b]: [ul][*]Handled most packets [*]Seperated commands from the client class [*]Reduced the client class by approximately[B] 92kb[/B] (from the original DeltaClean) [*]Loaded custom objects through array [*]Player deaths are handled by events [*]Fixed the combat delays [*]Skill/action checking not through process [*]Fixed the cycle time to 600ms [*]Packaged the server [*]Made objects and such be handled through a switch statement (to prevent future users to use if-and-else statments[/ul] Old features:
- Everything DeltaScape has - Grahams EventManager - Full Indentation across all classes - Removed over 1000 dead code fragments - Follows 100% Convention across classes (Except for the basic packaging + method names(way to many to refactor)) - Has multiple notorious Delta-Bugs Fixed - Runs ALOT smoother then regular DeltaScape - Has tips and guides on how to edit basic things for beginners - Works with most clients (Galkons refactored etc) - Will hold atleast 30% more players then an average DeltaScape - Alot more - Download and look. - Re-made Trading - X log fixes - Common Dupes fixed
Example of better combat: [img]http://seldom-pkz.net/seldom/combat.gif[/img] [b]To remove the debug messages:[/b] 1) Go to your Player class, 2) Find 'public boolean debug = true;' 3) Set it to false [b]Credits[/b] [ul][*]Myself [*]J Dog [*]Jonny J [*]b a l l a [*]Graham [*]Delta [*]Java' [*]Blakeman8192 [*]mmaKush[/ul]

item.dc:creator: @kingdomkey01 kingdomkey01
item.description:
@kingdomkey01 wrote:

Cowarooroo:

How do I add shops to this? I’m clueless…

Check shops.cfg, it’ll be in this folder:

data -> config -> shops.cfg

item.title: [317] Optimized Delta
item.dc:creator: @crazyfazespy crazyfazespy
item.description:
@crazyfazespy wrote:

What I did: 
Handled most packets
Seperated commands from the client class
Reduced the client class by approximately 92kb (from the original DeltaClean)
Loaded custom objects through array
Player deaths are handled by events
Fixed the combat delays
Skill/action checking not through process
Fixed the cycle time to 600ms
Packaged the server
Made objects and such be handled through a switch statement (to prevent future users to use if-and-else statments

Old features:
Quote

- Everything DeltaScape has
- Grahams EventManager
- Full Indentation across all classes
- Removed over 1000 dead code fragments
- Follows 100% Convention across classes (Except for the basic packaging + method names(way to many to refactor))
- Has multiple notorious Delta-Bugs Fixed
- Runs ALOT smoother then regular DeltaScape
- Has tips and guides on how to edit basic things for beginners
- Works with most clients (Galkons refactored etc)
- Will hold atleast 30% more players then an average DeltaScape
- Alot more - Download and look.
- Re-made Trading
- X log fixes
- Common Dupes fixed</blockquote>

lol if that really better then regular delta then itlast u did samthing to thath source
good job ++

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Optimized Delta
item.dc:creator: @kingdomkey01 kingdomkey01
item.description:
@kingdomkey01 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:13, topic:401269”][quote author=Rune-Xero link=topic=498332.msg3646128#msg3646128 date=1309383849]

I hope it does look bad, because it doesn’t matter how it looks. It matter how the source is programmed. I hope somebody that uses Delta uses this base and works from it to make it better. It’s a clean base, with no features.

Thank you, I’ve already completed a mining base with regenerating rocks. Woodcutting is the same thing.

Bro Delta has and always will fail.
[/quote]
Of course Deltascape is going to remain a fail when members are too lazy, and doesn’t know how to program to take the time and make something of Delta.

OT: This is alright mate, thanks for attempting and thanks for the release.[/quote]

Read full topic
